title: 106_s630
content: TRANSFER OF RESPONSIBILITY FOR OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF THE FLATHEAD IRRIGATION PROJECT, MONTANA. The purpose of this Act is to preserve family farms and ranches in Montana by transferring responsibility for the Flathead Irrigation Project without affecting water rights negotiations. Definitions include "contract" and "irrigation district." The Act of May 10, 1926 defines terms like "project" as the Flathead Irrigation Project, "Secretary" as the Secretary of the Interior, and "Tribe" as the Confederated Salish and Kootenai Tribes. The Secretary is required to offer a contract within a year of the Act's enactment. The Secretary must offer a contract to the irrigation district to operate and manage the project, including all rights and powers. The contract must identify trust responsibilities to the Tribe and ensure the United States can fulfill those responsibilities. The irrigation district must maintain instream flows to preserve fisheries and continue existing repayment obligations unaffected by the Act, with an option for accelerated payment. The Act requires the irrigation district to maintain instream flows for fisheries and uphold repayment obligations. It also includes provisions to amend repayment contracts, separate revenues for operation costs, and revoke the contract if the district damages tribal trust assets. The Act requires the irrigation district to maintain instream flows for fisheries, uphold repayment obligations, and protect tribal trust assets. Operation of the project as per the Bureau of Indian Affairs plan is presumed to protect tribal assets, and changes in operation are allowed unless the district refuses to comply. The Secretary must negotiate with the irrigation district promptly to enter into a contract within a year. The contract will transfer ownership of equipment and supplies paid for with project funds to the irrigation district. An inventory list of all supplies and equipment must be provided to the district. The Secretary will transfer ownership of equipment and supplies purchased with project funds to the irrigation district under a contract, excluding any real property rights or water rights. This Act does not impact water rights negotiations between Montana, the United States, and the Tribe.
